Thi=
s is a fascinating thing about Japanese. Some languages can be 
read for hu=
ndreds of years.The often cited example being Italian. 
Apparently Dante's =
Inferno is almost no problem at all to read for 
modern Italian speakers (o=
f which I am not one). On the other hand 
Japanese has changed very signifi=
cantly over the same period of 
time.

I'm not sure that Meiji Japanese sho=
uld be _that_ big of a deal - 
but maybe it's the combination of the fact t=
hat it is Military 
language and the fact that it was written 100 years ago=

it difficult.
